page.title: 15Clifton Junction industry(2)
page.content: {Pilkington's}tile factory covers an area of about fourteen acres. They also own some land on the other side of the{motorway}which they use as a tip. Pilkington's{employ}about{500 workers who make thousands of{tiles}a year. There are people working there all the time to look after the{kilns which are never turned off. {Chloride Batteries}have been at Clifton Junction since 1893. Before this a{bleach works}was on the factory site. The area of the factory is about eighteen acres. At one time{3000}people were {employed}by Chloride, but due to {automation}and a fall in sales, only about{800}work there now. Chloride concentrate on making specialist types of{batteries}for {submarines}and{aircraft.
